text: Let us talk about enthusiasm first of all. We still see long lines wherever you go. At the same time, some polling indicates maybe the fire in the belly is not as intense this time around for some voters, especially young voters, so pivotal for your election. Well look, DATE, obviously your first time around in some ways it was lightning in a bottle. There were so many young people who just automatically got involved and, you know, we have gone through DATE. The economy is tough, especially for young people and, yet, what I have been really encouraged about here in GPE and all across the country, we are still seeing just tons of volunteers getting involved, a lot of passion, a lot of interest. And I think the reason is they understand in some ways this election is more important than DATE. The choice in terms of the direction we want to take the country is very stark this time, so the stakes are big, and I think people wanna finish what we started in DATE. Is there anything you believe you failed at, not because ORG would not play ball, but that rests squarely on your shoulders that has you desperate to get that second term to atone for? Yeah, well...look, ultimately when you are ENTITY, you are always responsible, even if you have got an uncooperative ORG. We are very proud of the work we did to make sure we did not slip into a Great Depression, create CARDINAL new jobs, bring manufacturing, including the auto industry, back on its feet. But, there were a lot of things we did not get done that I think are important, making sure that we get comprehensive immigration reform done. We have done some things administratively, but I have got to help to bring the parties together to do that-- Well, you know,...the truth is that the things I can do, um, without ORG tend to be in the foreign policy area. And, you know, in that area I have not been able to move the peace process forward in the Middle East the way I wanted. But the truth of the matter is, that the parties, they have got to want it as well. So, um, we have got a lot of work to do, especially in rebuilding our middle class here in this country but ultimately it is going to require people coming together and ORG working with the executive branch.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview with Scott Thuman of ABC7

text: It is a big issue for TIME right now, and PERSON campaign says he left in DATE, Yours says it is DATE. Is he being dishonest with the NORP public? we were just talking about responsibility and as ENTITY of GPE it is pretty clear to me that I am responsible for folks who are working in the federal government, and you know, PERSON said the buck stops with you... now my understanding is that Mr. PERSON attested to the ORG multiple times that he was the chairman, CEO and president of ORG. And I think most NORP figure if you are the chairman, CEO and president of a company that you are responsible for what that company does. Ultimately Mr. PERSON is going to have to answer those questions because if he aspires to be president, CARDINAL of the things you learn is you are ultimately responsible for the conduct of your operations. But again, that is probably a question that he is going to have to answer and I think that is a legitimate part of the campaign. And you think he should answer that soon? Let us ask you, switch tables here a tiny bit. I want to know, what is it you absolutely love about campaigning and what is it you hate? But, you cannot say 'being away from your family'. What I love is the interactions with people and you know it is interesting. I think sometimes GPE reporters are surprised when they see me out of GPE and, you know, I am with folks not just here in GPE but when you also traveled in GPE on a bus tour and you are stopping in a local bar or going to a ORG hall or TIME I had a chance to sit down with CARDINAL incredible military spouses, and it gives you such energy and inspiration to hear about their lives. How they are thinking about their kids, how they are thinking about their futures. They are just good, decent people, and it gives you a lot of optimism. The thing I hate most, other than being away from my family, is sometimes, when you are on the road, you end up eating a lot of stuff that tastes really good at the time but later on in the day can catch up with you, and I am now getting to the age where being in my own bed as opposed to some other bed, is not always great for my back. Here is my fun question you, and I asked your colleague PERSON this DATE.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview with Scott Thuman of ABC7

text: I have got several important issues in NORP-American bilateral relations, which we will, of course, discuss. But first, let me come back to the events which happened DATE. Now, GPE is, of course, a country which lost CARDINAL people; GPE proper, PERCENT of the losses of the GPE. And it is self-sufficient to say Second World War and GPE. What do you tell your children, for instance, about the Second World War? Well, we have personal connections. My grandfather fought in World War II. He was part of PERSON's army. And my great uncle, my grandmother's brother, was one of those who liberated GPE, and so obviously, those memories are very important. And the DATE commemoration in GPE is so important because it reminds us of the extraordinary sacrifices that the then-GPE made and the strength of the alliance between the GPE and the NORP people. In fact, our current Ambassador in GPE, Ambassador PERSON, his father briefly fought with the NORP ENTITY. He was part of GPE operations there, was captured, escaped into GPE, and ended up fighting with the GPE ENTITY for a time. And that, I think, symbolizes how the joint NORP efforts helped to defeat fascism, and it is one of the most important military alliances of all time. Now that we are into reset, given DATE's certain responses, which are the common enemies of DATE? Well, obviously, terrorism is CARDINAL of them. Immediately after the tragic events in GPE, I called President PERSON and pledged that GPE would work in any way that GPE thought made sense in helping to find the perpetrators of this terrible act. We just recently had an attempted terrorist act in GPE, and it is a signal, I think, that whether these activities are happening in GPE or they are happening in GPE, that countries have to work together to make sure that these terrorists are apprehended, that their networks are destroyed, that their sources of financing dry up. And no single country is going to be able to do that on their own; countries are going to have to work together. And that is something that I am very much looking to increasing cooperation between GPE and GPE. Beyond that, though, I think it is important to recognize that the whole concept of reset between GPE and NORP relations is not just on issues of security.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Sergey Brilev of Rossiya TV

text: We have a lot of security issues that we have to discuss. Obviously, I am very proud of the START Treaty and our efforts to reduce our nuclear arsenals. But CARDINAL of the things that President PERSON and I have discussed is how can we really ramp up our commercial, our trade, our economic ties. How can we help to promote the innovation agenda in GPE? What are we doing around high-tech industries that can produce jobs and raise standards of livings for both the NORP people and GPE? And that is an area where I think you are going to see a lot of work and a lot of cooperation. CARDINAL of things we are very excited about is we set up a Presidential commission with CARDINAL active groups on everything from energy to high-tech. And I recently extended an invitation to President PERSON to visit GPE in DATE. And one of the things we hope he is going to be able to do is not just visit GPE, but also travel, for example, to Silicon Valley and see how the connections between universities and venture capital and business has been able to create some of the extraordinary inventions that all of us use DATE. Now that you mentioned the START Treaty, when are we going to ratify it? My hope is that we ratify it DATE on our side and---- Well, I'd like to see it happen before the election. Obviously, it is technical, and I think it is appropriate for the ORG to examine it, but we are going to be putting forward the text of the treaty, the annexes, all the necessary materials before the ORG in short order. And our hope is, is that they will be able to review it quickly and recognize that this is an important step in the efforts of both GPE and GPE to meet our obligations under the Non-Proliferation Treaty to lower our stockpiles, at the same time as we work together to hold other countries accountable on obligations regarding the Non-Proliferation Treaty. Well, that was the point actually of signing the treaty, to save money and also to convince the rest of the world. But then after what Mr. PERSON had to say DATE, are we convincing the rest of the world?
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Sergey Brilev of Rossiya TV

text: I think most countries around the world have recognized that the core principles of the Non-Proliferation Treaty, the NPT, would say that countries are--that have nuclear weapons should try to reduce their reliance on nuclear weapons, that countries that do not have them should forgo them, and that everybody has the right to peaceful nuclear energy. That principle has been embraced by a lot of countries. And there are countries like GPE, for example, that had gone fairly far down the path of developing a nuclear weapon and decided this did not make sense for us. GPE and GPE are CARDINAL outliers, countries that have insisted on flouting international rules and ORG ORG resolutions, are not cooperating the way they need to with the ORG. And so I have been very heartened by the cooperation that we have seen so far between GPE, GPE, the other members of the P-5-plus-1, in terms of imposing the kinds of pressure and sanctions that are necessary to get GPE to choose a more responsible path that will lead it back into the heart of the international community. Having signed the treaty, and having carried out several other things within the reset framework agenda, we have achieved a better mutual understanding. How can you convert it into something of a substance in such particular area as NORP security? Because also, ORG is a solution for those countries which are in, but ORG is not a solution for self-sufficient countries like GPE. Well, President PERSON has put forward some ideas about a new security architecture in Europe. We are examining them. I take them very seriously. But I think that the most important thing at this point is to work with the institutions we have to see if we can rebuild the trust that for some time had been lost. So, for example, I have been supportive of ORG-Russia consultation in a much more systematic way than has been observed over DATE. My sense is, is that all the parties in Europe, all the members of the ORG alliance, want to have a strong, cooperative relationship with GPE. a respect for territorial integrity of internationally recognized borders, a belief that a country's core sovereignty includes its ability to choose how it allies itself, a rejection of the notion of spheres of influence, whether it is GPE spheres or NORP spheres or NORP spheres.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Sergey Brilev of Rossiya TV

text: Within those broad principles, though, if you look--going back to your earlier question--the real threats against NORP well-being or GPE well-being to a large degree are at this point much more aligned than they have ever been. It has to do with nonstate actors. It has to do with the proliferation of nuclear weapons. It has to do with environmental catastrophes. It has to do with an integrated economy in which if you see a crisis in GPE taking place that can affect world markets. These are all issues in which cooperation rather than antagonism are the order of DATE. And I think President PERSON recognizes this. I have been very impressed with him. I find it very easy to do business with him, and I think we have established a relationship, a real trust that can be hopefully bearing fruit in the negotiations and conversations that we have in DATE to come. I will use this opportunity now that you mentioned GPE and the economic crisis. I had DATE DATE preparing for this interview, so I went fishing to GPE. I met someone called PERSON, I think, the captain of the boat. I caught QUANTITY. He said to me that he is got PERCENT less clients--well, then, of course, the fuel is up a MONEY per QUANTITY. And I was comparing his economic comments with my position, and strangely enough and luckily enough, I can actually afford more things in GPE DATE because of the ruble which is so stronger than the--comparatively than euro and dollar were meant to be. Where do you see the dollar, given the circumstances with the global economic crisis? Would you like to see a weaker dollar--although it does not sound nice for the NORP public, but still? My basic principle is to focus on the fundamentals of the economy. We have a market-based mechanism for determining the value of currencies. I think that if we have a strong GPE economy, we are going to have a strong dollar. And obviously, we have just gone through a very difficult period; the whole world has. We have seen stabilization, and the GPE economy is slowly strengthening in ways that, I think, if you'd asked DATE, we might have said that it was going to take longer than it has for that stabilization to take place. I am very concerned about what is happening in Europe.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Sergey Brilev of Rossiya TV

text: GPE is taking some very difficult measures; at least, they have put forward a plan that calls for difficult measures. And if we can stabilize Europe, that will be good for GPE and that will be good for GPE as well. But the key point today is the degree of integration among all economies. That is why I have said, and GPE is actively pursuing, the belief that the G-20 framework is so important, that we have to recognize that GPE, GPE, GPE, GPE, all these countries that traditionally have been viewed as on the periphery of economic decisionmaking, they are now at the core--GPE--are huge economies. And what happens there is going to impact us in the same way that what happens in GPE or GPE is going to impact them. The ORG shall indeed substitute the ORG? Well, my belief is, is that there is going to be a transition period, but that the ORG represents the economic framework of the future. the adoption issue. Well, I do not support those who say, Well, NORP killing NORP children. Absolute majority of the children adopted from GPE have their lives here. Even more important is the fact that more and more NORP are adopting NORP children in GPE. But then, still, CARDINAL kids have been killed--or, well, died in this country. It is an issue, especially after this NORP woman sent PERSON to GPE. Well, first of all, obviously, what happened with the small number of children who have been adversely affected is terrible. As you point out, there have been CARDINAL of NORP children adopted by GPE families. The overwhelming majority are leading happy, healthy lives. But ultimately, the policy has to be what is best for children, whether they are living in GPE or they are living in GPE. What we have done is to set up a bilateral discussion between our ORG and counterparts in NORP to find out how do we create an agreement in which children are protected. And as the father of CARDINAL children, obviously, it breaks my heart to think about children who have been vulnerable, have probably already gone through difficult situations and then are subjected to even more difficult situations in the past. But as you point out, I think it is also important to recognize that in the overwhelming majority of cases, adoptions are the absolute best thing for the child.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Sergey Brilev of Rossiya TV

text: ENTITY, let me thank you first on behalf of ORG, on behalf of ORG for giving us your time. We really appreciate that, sir. As you know, ENTITY, this is DATE of Nowruz, the Iranian New Year. What is your message to the NORP people as they face tough economic circumstances and infringement on their freedoms? Secondly, that the people of GPE respects the people of GPE, that we respect the traditions of GPE, the great history of GPE. We have differences with the Government, but we honor the people. And we want the people to live in a free society. We believe freedom is a right for all people and that the freer the world is, the more peaceful the world is. Please do not be discouraged by, you know, the slogans that say GPE does not like you, because we do, and we respect you. What do you say to the regime, sir? What would you say to the regime? I'd say to the regime that they have made decisions that have made it very difficult for the people of GPE. In other words, the NORP leaders, in their desire to, you know, enrich uranium, in spite of the fact that the international community has asked them not to, has isolated a great country. And that is, verifiably suspend your enrichment, and you can have new relationships with people in ORG, for example. And it is just sad that the leadership is in many ways very stubborn because the NORP-the NORP people are not realizing their true rights. And they are confusing people in GPE, as well, about their desires. And you know, it is a tough period if-in history for the NORP people, but it does not have to be that way. On the nuclear issue, sir, is there a solution to the problem that would both satisfy the GPE concern and, at the same time, allow GPE to proceed with nonmilitary nuclear energy research? Well, part of the problem is that it is very hard for people to trust ORG because they have not told the full truth, and that is why the people of GPE have got to understand there is great suspicions right now, not only in GPE but around the world.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Setareh Derakhshesh of VOA Persian News Network

text: And I thought, for example, the NORP proposed an interesting way, that says-and I have said publicly, and the NORP people need to know that I believe GPE has the right to have civilian nuclear power. I believe in civilian nuclear power. GPE is a sovereign country, and they should have it. The problem is, we just do not trust the Government because they have not been forthcoming about their enrichment of fuels to go into the reactor. And therefore, GPE's offer to provide fuel on a contractual basis and provide fuel on a consistent basis would help solve the problem. And that is, the NORP would not need to enrich; they would have fuel for their reactor; and the people would have cheaper electricity. And I support that idea. Sir, would you allow enrichment inside GPE if there are guarantees and international supervision? In other words, I- you know, once you-once a nation has not told the truth, it requires a lot of work to convince people that they will be telling the truth in the future. And my problem is, is that ORG has not been forthcoming, has not fully disclosed their programs like the ORG asked them to. And the better way forward is for there to be a contractual, solid obligation to provide fuel for a nuclear reactor, and then the NORP can have their civilian nuclear power. At a time when NORP are going through very difficult economic circumstances-there is high employment, high unemployment; there are high prices; there are unfilled promises-ORG just passed a new set of sanctions against the regime. Is GPE concerned, sir, that the regime might exploit these circumstances to whip up NORP sentiments, and also to use those and misuse them? No, I appreciate that. We are always concerned about the individual. You know, I am concerned about the mom trying to raise her child in a hopeful environment. And I am concerned about a child wanting to gain the knowledge so that he or she can realize her God-given talents. And of course, we are worried about the human condition. And any time a government is failing to meet the needs of the people-or a lot of times, not any time-but a lot of times governments have failed to meet the needs of their people, particularly in relatively nontransparent, nonfree societies, they always look for somebody to blame.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Setareh Derakhshesh of VOA Persian News Network

text: And I am not surprised that, you know, the leaders would blame GPE for the problems they, themselves, have created. And so yes, I mean, it enters my mind. On the other hand, the people of GPE must understand that the conditions exist in large part because of either mismanagement by the Government or isolation because of the Government's decisions on foreign policy matters, such as announcing they want to destroy countries with a nuclear weapon. I mean, it is irresponsible remarks like that which cause great credibility loss with ORG and the actions of which will-are affecting the country. ENTITY, if I may, I want to ask you about GPE also. DATE is the fifth anniversary of the start of the Iraq war, and you had a speech on the war on terror. Are you satisfied with the political situation in GPE in view of the improving security situation? And also, has GPE played a role in this? I am pleased because there is a modern Constitution in GPE. I am pleased because people have voted in GPE. I am pleased because there is , you know-they are heading toward Provincial elections in GPE. CARDINAL of the problems we do have in GPE is the-there is been some negative NORP influence, such as the exportation from GPE of certain weapons that have been used by extremists to murder and to kill people. Now, look, I understand GPE and GPE are going to have relations. After all, they have got a long border. But from my perspective, GPE has not been helpful in terms of helping this young democracy survive. I would think it would be in GPE's interests to have a peaceful neighbor. They had been at war at CARDINAL time with GPE. I would believe that a peaceful GPE would be in the long-term interests of the NORP people. And yet it is hard to have a peaceful GPE if there are elements inside the country that are trying to use violence and murder to continue to stir up sectarian doubts and raise concerns which will cause more violence. Yes. and they feel that this will undercut their position and that would strengthen the regime's hand. What are your thoughts on that, sir? My thought is, is that the reformers inside GPE are brave people. They have got no better friend than ENTITY and I ask for God's blessings on them, on their very important work. And secondly, that I would do nothing to undermine their efforts.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Setareh Derakhshesh of VOA Persian News Network

text: You know, it is DATE since the assassination of Prime Minister PERSON. And Mrs. PERSON said she was rather disappointed that you failed to mention her husband during the FAC ceremony DATE. How do you respond to that? Well, you know, the agreement is actually supposed to enter into force on DATE of his passing, of his killing. And I think that if, in fact, it does do so, it is a fitting thing, because none of us would be here if it had not been for him. He really started all this in a profound way. I know that the GPE conference started before his election, but it was his conviction and his strength and security that he conveyed to the people of GPE, I think, that made this whole peace process possible. And I never do anything in the process that I do not think about him. ENTITY, from the tragic assassination to the current situation, Prime Minister PERSON might put himself at the same risk as Mr. PERSON. So perhaps it is unjustified to put pressure on him to follow the GPE accord or the GPE track. Well, I do not think there is any question that the Prime Minister has put himself at some physical risk in pursuing the peace process. But I believe that it is important that the people of GPE know that, at least in my opinion, it is a good agreement; that it strengthens GPE's security needs; that the agreements made with the NORP are fully consistent with GPE. And the Prime Minister worked very, very hard to advance GPE's security interests. Just for example, there was the whole issue of what should be done with the people whom GPE believes have committed acts of violence and terrorism against NORP. And I am convinced that the NORP will now act against these people in a way that is consistent with the agreement and that will meet the Prime Minister's and GPE's needs. So that is an example of a whole array of security advances that were embedded in this agreement. And I think all NORP who support the peace process should support the agreement because I think it furthers the cause of peace. ENTITY, is it really the ORG, ORG, that is going to convene to revise the NORP covenant with your presence? Well, it is the ORG plus a number of other groups.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: William J. Clinton Interview With Shlomo Raz and Jacob Eilon of Israeli Television Channel 2

text: And some of these groups are embedded within the ORG; that is, they are dual membership for some of the people-in the ORG, in the executive council, in the other councils involved. And some are outside the ORG. But among other things at that meeting, we will seek a clear renunciation of the offending parts of the charter and a general endorsement of the agreement, this whole agreement, so that the process can be seen to be going forward with the support of those who represent grassroots NORP opinion. The Prime Minister wanted me to support this provision, this effort, and he fought very, very hard for this, as did a number of members of his ORG who were there, because they thought that there needed to be a debate in a NORP forum, even if it was controversial and heated, which would give to the NORP people some evidence not only of a commitment to follow an agreement but of a changing of the heart, an opening of the heart of the NORP toward the NORP. And I thought that argument had a lot of appeal, even though it was not without its hazards for Mr. PERSON. Because it is been DATE since anything big has happened, and because there is a lot of-he has his problems, too, among them the fact that the standard of living for most NORP is lower DATE than it was when the peace process began, because the enemies of peace keep interrupting the flow of normal life. So I agreed that if it was that important to GPE and Chairman PERSON were willing to try to accommodate that condition by the NORP, that I would go to GPE and address this group and ask them to support the peace and to renounce forever the idea of animosity toward and opposition to the existence of the state of GPE, and instead embrace the path not only of peace but of cooperation. I want to ask you about your visit to GPE. Do not you think, ENTITY, that this trip may be seen as a first step in recognizing an independent NORP state? Well, if so it would be, I think, wrong, because I have tried strictly to adhere to the position of GPE that we would not take a position on any final status issue.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: William J. Clinton Interview With Shlomo Raz and Jacob Eilon of Israeli Television Channel 2

text: CARDINAL of the reasons that I worked so hard at ORG to try to bring the parties together is, I thought it imperative to take this next big step along the peace process so that we could launch the final status talks and get them underway in good faith, so that neither side would seek to prejudge a final status issue. That is not what I am doing in going there. The Prime Minister wanted me to go there and wanted us all to make this pitch. I asked them if they would make some joint appearances and if they would both make the same speech to NORP and to NORP audiences. And they said they would do that. It would help the NORP to see PERSON saying the same thing to the NORP he says to the NORP. It would help the NORP, I think, also. And it would be a good thing for the Prime Minister to be able to give the same speech-whatever they decide to say, just say the same thing to both communities so that no one thinks that there is any evasion or shading or anything. I think, just little things like this to open up a little awareness of the other's position and build a little confidence, I think would be quite good. PERSON, why will not you release PERSON? Well, I agreed to review his case and to take the initiative to review it. I have not released him in the past because since I have been ENTITY in the CARDINAL previous normal reviews-that is, the ones that were initiated by his request for clemency-the recommendation of all my law enforcement and security agencies was unanimously opposed to it. But the Prime Minister felt so strongly about it-and I might say, every NORP Prime Minister I have dealt with on every occasion has asked me about PERSON. But you argued pretty-you had pretty harsh exchanges with PERSON, reportedly, about that? I thought then, I believe now, and I think the public opinion in GPE bears this out, that it was in GPE's interest to do this agreement on its own merits because it would advance the cause of NORP security and keep the peace process going. I think there is been a lot of reporting about this with which I do not necessarily agree. That is no criticism; I just want to tell you my perception. PERSON argued strongly for PERSON's release. He made the arguments that anyone who knows a lot about the case and thinks he should be released would make. But I took no offense at that.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: William J. Clinton Interview With Shlomo Raz and Jacob Eilon of Israeli Television Channel 2

text: He was representing what he believes to be the interest of GPE. And he did it in-you know, he does not make arguments halfway. You observe the Prime Minister, he is an aggressive person; he fights hard for what he believes. I took no offense at it at all. And I would ask you all to remember, when evaluating reports that tempers were frayed or strong language was used-now, remember, the CARDINAL of us, Mr. PERSON and Mr. PERSON and I, we were there for DATE. DATE I was there, I went home at TIME. The last time we were there on DATE, I was up for TIME and so were they. Now, I am amazed that we did not have more disruptive conduct and more harsh words, given how exhausted and frayed we were. But it shows you how hard the parties were trying, on the CARDINAL hand, to make peace, but on the other hand, to protect their security interests. He was desperately trying to find a way to make peace or to advance the peace process that would enable him to go home and sell it to his ORG and his constituency. And this PERSON issue was very important to him. But I took no offense at that. But still, ENTITY, there were many reports that you were very upset with Mr. PERSON and were quoted saying that his behavior was despicable. And this is the first opportunity I have had to say that. There was a moment in the negotiations when the CARDINAL guys split apart, and there was an issue raised that I thought was wrong. And I said so in very graphic terms. But I never used the word despicable to describe the Prime Minister. I did not do that. There was a moment where I thought-there were various moments in these negotiations when I thought-at least from my perspective, trying to be an honest broker-they were both wrong. You would expect this over DATE. But at that moment, the issue at stake had nothing to do with PERSON. It was an issue, a dispute between the NORP and the NORP; it had nothing to do with PERSON. And it is true that there was a moment in which there was a heated exchange in which I said something rather graphic, but I did not adversely characterize the Prime Minister in the way that is reported. I'd like to talk about the late PERSON.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: William J. Clinton Interview With Shlomo Raz and Jacob Eilon of Israeli Television Channel 2

text: I think you know, ENTITY, that when you said the phrase, shalom chaver, goodbye friend, I think you touched many many NORP in a very, very special way. And we have been curious, how did you come up with this? I even noticed you have a pin that says shalom chaver on your desk right here in FAC. I have many NORP working for me here, and they all knew how close I felt to Prime Minister PERSON. And we were-everybody was sort of coming up with ideas. And PERSON later told me that he had not seen those CARDINAL words used together before because chaver, it is sort of a special word; it goes beyond normal friendship. And CARDINAL of my-I wish I could say that I knew enough Hebrew that I came up with it, but one of my staff members suggested that I say it. And they explained it to me, what it meant, and it seemed to be perfect for what I was trying to say. I must say, for me, that was more than a political loss. I felt very close to the Prime Minister, to Mrs. PERSON. I got to know their children, grandchildren. And I think always when I am pushing the peace process forward that I am doing it not just for myself but maybe also a little for him. And I must say, in these last negotiations I was very pleased to see that Prime Minister PERSON-I saw in his eyes, I could almost see in his eyes the moment when he really made the decision that, well, maybe the NORP were going to make sufficiently specific security commitments that would be on a sufficiently clear timetable that he could sell not just to the NORP public at large but to a decisive portion of his own constituency, which is a very different thing, as all of you know better than I do. And he could see that, that he could personally believe that it would advance GPE's security. And I saw that look in his eyes. I felt from that point on that eventually we would get an agreement. And that is the look that you want to see in a leader's eyes in a situation like that, because I still believe that the right formula is peace and security, and that you really cannot have one without the other.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: William J. Clinton Interview With Shlomo Raz and Jacob Eilon of Israeli Television Channel 2

text: ENTITY, a lot of people say this might be your first trip to GPE, but it is not. I have been there a couple of times. I remember, PERSON and I went to see ORG in GPE. Gosh, I remember going to some nice pubs when I was a drinking man in GPE. We are looking forward to seeing you there, too. No new tuxes. Are you going to take a new tux this time? I am going to take a tux, and I am going to take tails. And do not tell anybody, but I had to rent them. I am sure you will not tell anybody. This is entirely between us. I am looking forward to- it is a huge honor to be invited by Her Majesty to stay in FAC. It is hard to imagine me even considering staying in FAC when I was living in GPE, GPE. It is just one of those things. And FAC has got a tremendous mystique to it, and so PERSON and I are really looking forward to coming. And you pinch yourself about those things too. What would you like to see come out of this trip in terms of- in addition to the fun part? Well, I have got some business to do with PERSON. We have got a lot of things to discuss. We are going to talk about how to continue to spread freedom and peace. We will talk about how to work the compassion agenda on ORG, for example. We are going to spend some time talking about that. I value his advice, and I-every time I visit with him, whether it be on the phone or on video or in person, I come away with a-some interesting ideas about how to advance a positive agenda. Secondly, I look forward to speaking to the people of your great country. I am going to have a chance to give a speech to talk about the importance of our relationship, the unique relationship between GPE and GPE. And I will have a chance to answer some questions, I am sure, from what we call the Fourth Estate here, the mighty media. I look forward to it. And PERSON on DATE TIME-and he would probably have told you-is expecting there to be quite a lot of protesters about the war. Well, freedom is a beautiful thing, I would first say, and are not you lucky to be in a country that encourages people to speak their mind.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Sir David Frost of BBC Television

text: And I value going to a country where people are free to say anything they want to say. Secondly, I would say that I understand you do not like war, and neither do I. But I would hope you understand that I have learned the lessons of September the 11th, 2001, and that terrorists declared war on GPE and war on people that love freedom, and I intend to lead our Nation, along with others like our close friends in GPE, to win this war on terror, that war is my last choice, not my first choice, but I have an obligation as the ENTITY to keep our country secure. And at the same time, you will be working with PERSON, and what is the key to your working together so well? I mean, it is like you have a special relationship. Is partially the bond, the bond that you are both men of strong faith? PERSON is a man of strong faith. You know, the key to my relationship with PERSON is he tells the truth, and he tells you what he thinks, and when he says he is going to do something, he is going to do it. I trust him, therefore. I have seen him, under some tough-tough circumstances, stand strong, and I appreciate that in a person. The other thing I admire about PERSON is that he is got a vision beyond the current. In other words, he can see a world that is peaceful, and he agrees with me that the spread of democracy and freedom in parts of the world where there is violence and hatred will help change the world, that there are reformers in the Middle East that long for democracy, that long to live in a free world. And PERSON, like me, agrees-kind of rejects the elitist point of view that only a certain type of person can adapt the habits of freedom and democracy. And he knows that freedom in the Middle East will help change that world in dramatic fashion. So it is an historic moment which he has been willing to seize, and I am honored to be working with him to seize the moment.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Sir David Frost of BBC Television

text: And in terms of as you look at the world, ENTITY, at the moment and you see the protesters in GPE or wherever they are and you see that poll that came out, an ORG poll DATE that shows that GPE was second among the most dangerous countries in terms of war in the world-level, for God's sake, with GPE and GPE when you see things like that, do you think the world is out of step with GPE, or GPE is out of step with the world? Well, first of all, you have got to know, I do not pay attention to the polls. I have got a job to do for the NORP people. It is a job that was changed on DATE, and I refuse to-I refuse to forget-I will never forget the lessons, is a better way to put it, of what happened to this country. And there are terrorists who are willing to kill innocent life in order to create fear and chaos. There are terrorists who want the free world to retreat from duties so that they can impose ORG-type governments and enslave people. There are people like PERSON, who tortured and maimed and killed and, at the same time, threatened and created the conditions of instability. And I know some people do not understand the need to deal with that, but I feel firmly we must deal with those issues. But do you need to woo people more in the rest of the world? We wooed-we did a pretty good job of wooing them at ORG. After all, remember, CARDINAL was a unanimous vote that said, after DATE of sending messages to Mr. PERSON for him to disarm, CARDINAL said, Disarm or there will be serious consequences. In other words, the world, at least ORG, came together and sent a clear signal. But I can assure you, serious consequence is not more resolutions or more debate. Serious consequence was with dealing with Mr. PERSON DATE, before it became too late. And I understand people do not agree with that position. But nevertheless, I am convinced that the decisions we made- and there is a lot of countries that made that decision with us-that decision will make the world more peaceful and more free. That decision is in the long-term interests of people who love freedom.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Sir David Frost of BBC Television

text: And will you ever be able to forgive PERSON and Chancellor PERSON for their actions of that time in undermining the second resolution? It is like, I can understand why people express their disagreement with the policy. I understand not everybody is going to agree with every decision that I make or others make. But I have had meetings with PERSON and PERSON since then. PERSON has now committed NORP troops to GPE, which is a very important mission, to help stabilize that good country as it not only enacts a constitution but heads toward elections. And I appreciate the contribution of ORG toward GPE. I am proud to say that it is a vital contribution, and I appreciate their willingness to work with us. Again, we are not going to agree on every issue, but a Europe which works closely with GPE and an GPE which works closely with Europe means the world will be better off. The difference really is, between PERSON and them, is that PERSON sees Europe as a partner of GPE, and they perhaps see Europe as a rival of GPE. I do not think GPE sees that, for starters. In my conversations with PERSON, they never yielded that impression. I think GPE understands it is important for the bilateral relationship between GPE and GPE to be strong. It is in our economic interests that it is strong. It is in the interest of peace that it be strong. I understand there was kind of this notion of multipolarity, which means that somehow the values of GPE need to be offset. But we are for peace; we are for freedom. This country is leading the world when it comes to fighting ENTITY. And I can assure you, having studied this issue a lot, and I understand the pandemic of ENTITY on the continent of Africa, we will be better off-the people of Africa will be better off if Europe and GPE work together to fight the pandemic of ENTITY. And what about the-I gather that you have some misgivings about the proposed NORP army, the danger that it might be a threat to ORG. Yes, here is the thing, first of all, I believe that the NORP defense force ought to take on more responsibility on those missions which ORG turns down. I think it is good for GPE interests.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Sir David Frost of BBC Television

text: I think it is good for ORG's interests, so long as the defense force does not undermine the vitality of ORG. And PERSON tells me that the discussions he is having with other NORP countries will in no way undermine ORG, and I take his word for it. He is been a man who is been true to his word on a lot of issues, and I believe he will be true to his word on this issue. The fact that we did not find them, and so on, has been much discussed. But do you think that you were the victim of a failure of intelligence in a way? It is the same intelligence that caused ORG to pass resolution after resolution after resolution. It is the same intelligence that was used by my predecessor to bomb GPE. I am very confident we got good intelligence. And not only that, Mr. PERSON, who went over to kind of lead the effort to find the weapons or the intent of weapons, came back with a report that clearly stated that Mr. PERSON would-had been in material breach of Resolution 1441. In other words, had the inspectors found what PERSON found, they would have reported back to ORG that he was in breach, that he was in violation of exactly what ORG expected him not to do. We will find the truth. But this guy for DATE had been hiding weapons, deceiving weapons. He had dual-use programs that could have been sped up. Not only was he a danger to the free world-and that is what the world said; the world said it consistently-he was a danger to his own people as well. Remember, we discovered mass graves with CARDINAL of men and women and children clutching their little toys, as a result of this person's brutality. But in terms of-did you feel, in terms of if there was not a failure of intelligence, that there was a sort of exaggeration in what was predicted? I mean, did you ever believe that stuff, for instance? Did you ever believe that stuff about him having weapons of mass destruction that could be unleashed in TIME, or did you never really believe that? But you did not believe that. Well, I believed a lot of things. And I know that for the sake of security, he needed to be dealt with.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Sir David Frost of BBC Television

text: After all- again I repeat this because it is a very important point that people in your country must remember, and that is, the world had spoken, universally spoken, about this man's danger for DATE. And in order for-at the very minimum, in order for a multinational organization to be valid and effective, something has to happen other than resolutions. And when an organization says, If you do not disarm -in other words, in order to say, They do not disarm, intelligence convinced a lot of nations, including GPE, that he had weapons. In other words, he had to disarm something. If you do not do that, there will be a serious consequence. A serious consequence, in this case, was removing PERSON so that his weapons programs would not be activated. And PERSON found evidence of weapons programs. He found some biological weapons-evidence of biological weapons. And it does not take much time-- But we really need the big discovery, do not we? Well, that is pretty big, what I just told you. Now remember, for a long period of time, it was assumed that he did not have a nuclear weapons program. And yet, after DATE, the world had to- changed its attitude about this man's nuclear weapons program and admitted that it was very advanced. A nuclear weapon in the hands of somebody like PERSON, particularly given the lessons of September the 11th, 2001, would be a horrendous development. And we had to deal with him. And we did-in a way, by the way, that was a compassionate way. We spared innocent life. We targeted the guilty, and we moved hard and fast. And very little of GPE was touched in toppling PERSON. Did we, in fact-people have said, ENTITY, as you know, that the same meticulous planning that went into winning the war did not go into winning the peace, and we were a bit unprepared for some of the surprises, the unpleasant surprises, you know, the terrorists and all of that that came along. We look at all contingencies and are dealing with the contingencies. CARDINAL, the oil revenues would be blown up; the oil fields would be destroyed. As a matter of fact, oil production is up to CARDINAL or QUANTITY a day, to the benefit of the NORP people.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Sir David Frost of BBC Television

text: Remember, there was speculation about sectarian violence, that the long-suppressed NORP or NORP may take out their anxieties and their frustrations on the NORP. There was talk about mass starvation; it did not happen. And so a lot of the contingency that we had planned for did not happen. What has happened is that in a relatively small part of the country, there are NORP You call it now the Ba'athist Triangle. And they are attacking not only coalition forces; they are attacking innocent NORP, because what they are trying to do is stop the spread of progress. Well, I would call it a desperate attempt by people who were totally in control of government, through tyrannical means, to regain power. This is nothing more than a power grab. They have got a different mission. They want to install a ORG-type Government in GPE, or they want to seek revenge for getting whipped in GPE. But nevertheless, they all have now found common ground for a brief period of time. And what we will do is, we will use NORP intelligence; we will use NORP security forces-we are up to CARDINAL NORP folks in CARDINAL type of uniform or another securing the country-to be a integral part of chasing these killers down and to bring them to justice before they kill innocent life. But it must have taken us a bit by surprise, or otherwise we'd have prepared for it, the level of this-the combination of the, what, CARDINAL, perhaps, foreign terrorists who came into GPE, and so on. We have been there for DATE, PERSON, which seems like a long time, particularly giving the news cycles the way they are. I am certainly not complaining about the news cycles, but nevertheless, there is a certain sense of impatience that has now crept into the world. And my job is to enable our operators and military to make adjustments necessary to succeed. We have got the same strategy, which is a peaceful GPE. The tactics shift, depending upon the decisions of the enemy. We are making progress. What they want to do is, they want to shake the will of the free world. And the good news about having a partner like PERSON is, he will not be shaken. I heard PERSON stand up with a strong statement after the NORP police had been murdered. And we, of course, send our sympathies and prayers to the NORP people.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Sir David Frost of BBC Television

text: But PERSON said, They are not going to run us out. And that is what these terrorists need to hear. And more importantly, or as importantly, the NORP citizens need to hear that. They need to know that we will not leave the country prematurely. We are not going to cut and run; and CARDINAL, we believe they have the capacity to run their own country. PERSON, in his speech on TIME, said, We are not going to retreat QUANTITY. I mean, we are there for how long it takes to produce a successful NORP democracy, are we? Well, we do not think it will be DATE and DATE, because, first of all, we think the NORP people are plenty capable of running their own country, and we think they want to run their own country. Oh, yes-- Well, just to discuss ways to do-to assure the NORP people that we have confidence in their capability. See, some in the world, some in the world do not believe that GPE can run itself. They believe that, Might as well let them have a military dictatorship or a tyrant. I disagree, and PERSON disagrees with that. We believe that democracy will take hold in GPE, and we believe a free and democratic GPE will help change the Middle East. There are CARDINAL of reformers that are desperate for freedom. Freedom- freedom is not GPE's gift to the world or GPE gift to the world. Freedom is the Almighty's gift to everybody who lives in the world. Is there any likelihood that PERSON himself could be behind this violence? He had rape rooms, and people disappeared because they spoke out against him. We have discovered mass graves. We did the NORP people a great favor by removing him. So I would not be surprised that any kind of violence is promoted by him, but I do not know. All I know is, we are after him. That is one of the interesting things. I mean, nobody has time for TIME for PERSON. Some people are worried in GPE and around the world by the idea of regime change, because they say, Once we have done regime change, GPE and GPE with PERSON, what can we say if GPE wants to do regime change with GPE, or GPE wants to do regime change with GPE? Well, see, I can understand their concerns, except they forgot the history. This issue has been discussed in ORG for DATE.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Sir David Frost of BBC Television

text: And ORG, as a multilateral international body, passed resolution after resolution after resolution calling for PERSON to disarm. In other words, the diplomatic process went forward. And to the critics, I would say that there will be diplomacy when it comes to GPE and GPE. It is tyrants that take advantage of that. Tyrants- if tyrants do not fear-feel like they can torture and kill with impunity, feel like they can blackmail the world, and all the world does is put out empty words, it makes multilateralism extremely ineffective. If I could take TIME to remind your viewers that, obviously, not every situation needs to be solved militarily. And I would refer people to GPE, where we have got a multilateral attempt to convince PERSON to get rid of his nuclear ambitions. We understand, just like PERSON, that he has been torturous to his people-people in GPE are starving to death-and that weapons of mass destruction in his hands given his history, just like weapons of mass destruction in PERSON's hands given his history, is a very dangerous element. It is a dangerous-it inhibits the capacity for peace and freedom to spread. But what I have done is, I have convinced GPE and GPE and GPE and GPE to speak with CARDINAL voice to NORP, and say, Get rid of your nuclear ambitions. We are also, at the same time, working on a counterproliferation regime that will stop his ability to ship weapons of mass destruction or a nuclear warhead to a terrorist group. In other words, we are working together in a multilateral, multinational fashion to bring peace and stability to the world. Someone who knows how passionate you are about this war on terror and GPE and so on said, I know ENTITY, and I think, in terms of his legacy, he'd rather-I will tell you how strongly he feels. He said he'd rather be defeated by the voters than by the terrorists. I'd rather not be defeated by either. And we will not be defeated by the terrorists. I say that confidently, because the allies in the war on terror are strong and steadfast, and there is no stronger and steadfast ally in the war on terror than PERSON. He understands the stakes. He understands as well that the spread of freedom and democracy, in the long run, will defeat terror.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Sir David Frost of BBC Television

text: And that is why the battle-the stakes are so high in GPE right now. By the way, GPE is a front in the war on terror. And it is important for people to understand that, because the war takes place elsewhere. And in-one of the reasons that people say, in the NORP world-obviously there was your landmark speech DATE-but in the NORP world, that you will not really be able to address the balance against GPE until GPE is seen not to tilt towards GPE in the Middle East. What do you think about that? I think it is an excuse, because GPE-I am the first ENTITY ever to go to ORG And say, two-- No President has ever said that. And I said it, and I said it with conviction, because I believe it is in GPE's interest that there be a peaceful NORP state, and I know it is in the NORP' interest. However, to achieve a peaceful NORP state, the emergence of a peaceful NORP state, a state where people are willing to risk capital, a place where people are willing to develop an economy, there must be a focused effort to defeat terror. I went in and embraced, in GPE, GPE, PERSON. And the reason I did so, PERSON, is because he came to FAC and he said, I will join you in the fight against terror. We are not going to allow the few to destroy the hopes of the many. As well, I could sense in his talk, in his feeling, that he has-he is got great trust in the NORP people. In other words, given the chance, the NORP people will develop the habits of democracy, and out of that will come a great state, a peaceful state. And I trusted him, and we were working with him. We were making good progress. And I was working with PERSON. I gave a speech on DATE, which says, All of us have responsibilities, and you, GPE, have a responsibility. Do you think PERSON could ever emerge as a man of peace? I believe he wants peace for his people. I mean, he is a man who has presided over suiciders, where he has to go to the funerals of women and children because some cold-blooded killer is trying to destroy the hopes of all the people in the region. And I believe he believes in a NORP state.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Sir David Frost of BBC Television

text: I have asked him in FAC, I said, Listen, am I out there by myself on a NORP state, or will you support it? But both of us understand, as do a lot of other people, that for a state to emerge, there must be a focused effort to get after the ORG killers, for example, who want to destroy the hopes of the people that believe in a NORP state. Anyway, let me finish my PERSON story, if you do not mind. I embraced the guy, and I believe that he is a-I believe he is a partner with whom we can work, and he is shoved out. Progress is being made, and he is shoved aside by the old guard. You are going to get asked about, obviously, in GPE, what is going to happen to our NORP detainees. PERSON was talking about it in ORG DATE and saying, hopefully they'd be tried before a proper court or repatriated to be tried in the GPE Will you have any good news for us on that? You mean right here, sitting right here, me and you, talking-the good news is, CARDINAL, they will be treated fairly, like they are. And CARDINAL, I am working closely with PERSON to come up with a solution that he is comfortable with. And I emphasize, a solution that he is comfortable with. These prisoners are being treated-these were illegal non-combatants picked up off of a battlefield. And they are being well-treated, and they will go through a military tribunal at some point in time, which is-a military tribunal, which is in international accord- or in line with international accords . As we approach the end of this interview, ENTITY-I could carry on for TIME, actually, but I know you have got a lot to do, more than the rest of us. As we approach the end of this interview, what would you say is the most important lesson you have learned in life in the Presidency? The most important lesson in life in the Presidency is to have a clear vision of where you want to lead, and lead. It is a world that is more free and therefore more peaceful; a world based upon human rights, human dignity, and justice; a world that does not discriminate between CARDINAL group of people or-a vision that does not discriminate between CARDINAL group of people or another, because I believe all people have the desire to be free.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Sir David Frost of BBC Television

text: With all the changes that are being proposed, one that is paramount in the eyes of many NORP, particularly those on fixed incomes, is how they are going to maintain their current standard of living with the soaring natural gas prices. I went around doing a little interview with my friends here, and that seemed to be one of the prime issues. And I just wonder, what do you contemplate happening in regards to these people? Well, I think what we are talking about is the same old problem of inflation. I am not sure that that is the best idea, because we found out when we decontrolled gasoline, the oil prices, that the price went down, not up. It encouraged more exploration and more development at the source. And maybe the same thing would happen with natural gas, but no decision has been made on that. But the people on the fixed incomes are, of course, always the ones who suffer first in inflation. Our program is aimed at bringing that down. And I have to say, not enough recognition has been paid to the fact that we have brought it down. We brought it down to single digit, where it is been for DATE-double digit. And I think that we are going to continue bringing it down with the program that we have in place. That has to be-I know DATE a great concern of the country, and it is of ours, is unemployment and this recession. But underlying that, helping cause that, everything comes back down to the fact that we have been in the longest-in fact, the world has been in the longest sustained period of runaway inflation in world history. And we are very happy about it. As a matter of fact, we have succeeded beyond our expectations, and that is what is contributed to the coming deficit. You know, government gets a profit from inflation. If it is a sales tax, and the price of a commodity goes up, and the sales tax is based on percentage, the government's percentage goes up. In the income tax for ORG, that is been the big steal, where people getting cost-of-living pay raises have been moved up into upper-income tax brackets. DATE, a sizeable percentage of the normal working people in this country are up to the PERCENT bracket. And so we have not been able to turn it down to where prices are going down, but we have cut that rate at which they are going up.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Skip Weber of the Iowa Daily Press Association in Des Moines

text: And there is fear on the part of many that these farms are going to go under. Can you provide any signs of encouragement for the GPE farmer? We have an GPE farmer as our Secretary of ORG. And we know that this is the whole basis of any economy; has to be that. CARDINAL of the things where we believe government can participate and be of help-and we are trying desperately to do this-is to encourage foreign markets, export markets, because there is no question, the NORP farmer can and does produce more than the people in our own country can eat, so he has to have an export market. He is been caught worse than most people in the cost-price squeeze of inflation. The cost of the things he buys, even the finished products of the food that he himself grows, when he then buys that in the form of bread and so forth in the market, he finds that he is on the low end of the totem pole when he sells that raw product, but he is paying like everyone else is, the inflated price as it is gone through the industrial processes. We do not believe that government, as we have known in the past, is the answer of a--continuing to control and subsidize the farm. What we must do with government is help agriculture get back into the market in getting a fair price for what it produces. I was doing quite a bit in the promotion of gasohol. We have had plans for many more plants here in GPE, but the plans seem to be falling by the wayside now because of a loss of ORG funds. Well, we are reducing a great deal of our subsidy now of synthetics, simply because we believe that industry has become involved enough, that the free marketplace should take hold and help with that. I can recall a visit that you made to GPE DATE on behalf of ORG. PERSON-he worked with my dad down at ORG-and at that time, I think the thing we were talking about was socialized medicine. But very vivid in my mind in regards to the remarks that you made then-and then also, back in GPE, I recall in an interview that you talked about what you had done in GPE as ENTITY in terms of welfare. And as I recall, you were talking about how, evidently, you were allowed to experiment with the welfare programs there.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Skip Weber of the Iowa Daily Press Association in Des Moines

text: I am just wondering, in regards to your new approach here on federalism, if your experience in GPE in terms of welfare played a major role in your thinking in changing this plan? Yes, that and DATE as ENTITY there when I saw how extravagant and wasteful it was to have to run a program where ORG imposed every rule and restriction as to how you must use the money, establish the priorities. The priorities are not the same in community after community or State after State. They say, This problem GPE has decided is of this priority, and therefore most of the money must be spent here. But you can come to a community where that is not their major priority, but they do have another problem that they need to help on, but they do not have the flexibility to switch the funds. And this is what we are trying to do with the new federalism program. I could cite chapter and verse of horror stories about this and about these programs. My first veto of a ORG program, when I was ORG, was a program that on the surface sounded just fine. It was one of the poverty programs, and it was in a rural county of GPE, a project-they were going to put CARDINAL able-bodied welfare recipients to work in the county parks, maintaining and helping to keep them clean, the parks. That is exactly the type of thing that we want to do. My veto was because under their rules, CARDINAL the budget would have gone for CARDINAL administrators to handle the affairs of the CARDINAL people that were going to work in the park. And I thought that was a little unbalanced, and I vetoed it, and ORG had DATE to override the veto. They did not override it when I made public why I was vetoing it. I have copies of some minutes of ORG in a meeting that you participated in. CARDINAL of the sections here is in regards to welfare, and they are quoting you as saying that CARDINAL of the major reasons for keeping welfare at the NORP level is the likelihood that differing benefit levels among the States was based on a court ruling handed down while you were ENTITY of GPE. Do you recall that? And it said the courts had struck down the GPE residency requirements for welfare because it was a Federal program. The ENTITY implied that if ORG got out of the program, residency requirements might be acceptable to the courts. Is that a problem here in regards to your welfare change?
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Skip Weber of the Iowa Daily Press Association in Des Moines

text: No, and this will be one to see as we work with all these people-I gesture because I am in the statehouse-to see if this is one of the things that could also then be helpful. It is true that the welfare standards vary, based on-and this is under the NORP domination of the program-so these people who say, Well, this ORG might cheat and not give as much as another State, are talking through their hats, because that is the present situation. But ORG insists on minimums that are based on percentages of what is a basic cost of living in the various areas. But because NORP money was involved, the States had residency requirements so that you had to legitimately be a citizen of that State in order to get welfare. When ORG-the court-on the basis of the ORG funds, struck that down, you found people just going shopping. And there was a great influx, not only into GPE, GPE-that was when its great problem developed. People only saw the end result of the amount of money that was being paid. They did not translate it into the added cost of living, of living in those places. Theoretically, you were not supposed to be better off in CARDINAL State or the other, that the lower amount was because of the lower cost of living in that area. But today, our idea is to find out if this is a part of what they want, to get the help of the ORG and local officials in fleshing out this concept that we have created in turning these programs back. So we are quoting here in regards to ORG-the suggestions made here. Under consideration is a voucher system for ORG. This-although here we are still in the early stages of trying to find a better method of providing the needed care for-ORG is the program for the older; ORG is the program that we have suggested ORG take over instead of giving back and to find a way of doing it that will maintain the funds that are needed for people with a true illness or injury and not the waste, the shocking waste that we have DATE. For example, I can give you a case-let us say this is not in ORG or ORG-that has just come to us, a man who told the story himself. He fell at work and broke his finger, went to the emergency division of the hospital, and they X-rayed and then splinted the finger.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Skip Weber of the Iowa Daily Press Association in Des Moines

text: And then an attendant there told him, when he said he was going back to work, said, Well, you know that under the rules you are entitled to DATE at full pay without returning to work. Well, he said, No, I want to go back to work. Believe it or not, they kept him there for TIME trying to persuade him to take DATE. What business was it of theirs? They were there to heal him. And then, he added to his story, he went back to work. And he told that DATE he called in a doctor that he'd been referred to to check the finger on how it was coming. And the doctor spent a total of TIME looking at the X-ray and looking at his finger and submitted a bill to the government for $MONEY. Now, we think there are better ways to run a railroad. Shifting gears here a little bit, a lot of people seem to be picking your budget apart in terms of the money that you want to spend on the military. Why are you so strong in your support of this additional spending? I am strong for military spending for this reason. In DATE before this administration, the military was literally starved. Even with our military buildup, we will not even be back in the range of ability to stand in the face of our adversaries, GPE, until DATE-DATE. We will still be below them no matter how much we do now. But the truth is we are only spending PERCENT-our military budget is PERCENT of the gross national product. In DATE, in DATE and DATE, this averaged PERCENT with the military budget. And even in DATE, without the Vietnam war or the Korean war, it was PERCENT, PERCENT. So, in point of history, we are not up to what used to be considered the normal peacetime budget. But we have to show our adversaries that we have the will to defend ourselves. They have thought for DATE we do not . But coupled with that, my idea of the real way to save on defense is with them knowing that they are going to have to accept that we are going to build up to their level for our own security. I want to sit down-and we already are sitting down with them-to discuss legitimate arms reductions, and that would be the major savings in defense and for both sides.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Skip Weber of the Iowa Daily Press Association in Des Moines

text: DATE they are literally starving their people of consumer products in order to maintain this great military buildup. We think they have been able to get away with this because we have been unilaterally disarming for DATE. When they see that we mean it-I think a cartoon told it all DATE. There was a cartoon that showed PERSON talking to a NORP general and he was saying, I liked the arms race better when we were the only ones in it. By them, obviously you are talking about the NORP. It just dawned on me, one of my colleagues here wanted me to ask you if you have ever been in the FAC before. I do recall sleeping out on the lawn. I am old enough to remember when air conditioning was only found in motion picture theatres, and on some of those hot GPE TIME, this FAC lawn out here would literally be covered with whole families that would bring a blanket and come over to the lawn and sleep all night around the FAC lawn from all the residences around here. Swinging back here, would you favor moving up the PERCENT cut in ORG taxes from DATE to some time in DATE? I would be very pleased to see that, because I think it would be beneficial, except that those who are proposing it are then proposing in return that we cancel DATE cut. Now unencumbered, just a simple move up, yes, I would favor that. I think that one of the things that could have mitigated if not prevented the present recession is if we had gotten our original request. We originally wanted a PERCENT, not a PERCENT cut, retroactive to DATE. And I think if that had been in place, there might be a different situation with regard to the recession. As it was, to get the bill we had to cut to PERCENT on the first installment and delay to DATE in order to get passage of the bill. Many economists are predicting that the economy is going to start turning around in DATE. If it does not , what will you do? Well, I think we are going to begin to see turns then. The regrettable thing is that the last to recover is unemployment when you are coming out of a recession and that is our major problem DATE-the people that are without jobs. So we believe that our program that is in place of cutting the cost of government and reducing the percentage that government takes in taxes is the answer.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Skip Weber of the Iowa Daily Press Association in Des Moines

text: ENTITY, I assume that your trip to Europe, after your reelection, was very well tailored, and we can imagine why you go to GPE and to GPE. But there are lots of-lots of speculation about why you decided to go to GPE. So what was behind this decision? I have been trying to think about when this thought got in my mind. I think-I have to credit your Prime Minister, who, in FAC, said, You need to come to our country. And I thought about it, and I think I told PERSON then, when she was my National Security Adviser, before I named her Secretary of ORG, that would be a great idea. I'd like to come, and I am thankful for the invitation, because I want to say to the world, Freedom is a beautiful thing, and here is a country that is working hard to promote democracy. The spirit of your Prime Minister, talking about overcoming the difficulties to become a free society, is-was just wonderful. I have always felt like countries like GPE are very important for the world to know more about, and-because, as you know, I am a big believer in liberty, and this is a country which is succeeding. And it is not-there is bumps in the road. It is going to be one of the highlights of the trip; it really is. You have, obviously, a very good relationship with ORG and the other governments of so-called new Europe. But the public does not always necessarily agree with our Government and with NORP policy. And you, many time, stress that you want to have a very good relationship with the whole Europe. So what is your strategy to improve the relationship with the nations, with the citizens? Well, first of all, nobody likes war. And basically what you are referring to is my decision to go into GPE. And I can understand why citizens, particularly if they did not feel threatened by PERSON, would say, We do not like war, and we do not agree with what ENTITY decided. And I know that. But now they have got to see what is happening in GPE. CARDINAL people voted in the face of terror. And so what is going to be very important for me is to connect that free country emerging with peace for their children and grandchildren. In other words, there has to be a connection in order for people to say, Well, now I understand what, you know, what the policy means.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Slovak State Television

text: It is a-and so one of the reasons-that is what I will speak about not only-I mean, in Europe, it is very important to make that connection. It is -ours is a-mine is a mission and a trip that says, We share values, human rights and human dignity and rule of law and minority rights and respect for women. And therefore, it is those values that should unite our voices when it comes to spreading those values in parts of the world that are troubled parts of the world, GPE or GPE or, as you saw recently, in GPE. I am convinced that as democracy-and particularly, GPE and GPE-as democracy takes hold there, the people of GPE will see, Gosh, I am beginning to understand what ENTITY was trying to do. GPE and you, personally, helped to fulfill the vision of free, democratic, and united Europe. But there is something missing from this picture, and people feel that they are treated like second-class NORP because of visa. And I am sure you will hear about the visa very often, not only in GPE but also in ORG. I know your Government has many other priorities, maybe much, much bigger priorities. But can I count on your leadership, ENTITY, on this issue? No, I have heard about the visa issue. I mean, yes, I have heard about the visa issue. In other words, what I was saying, No, this is not a minor issue. This is an issue that our friends have brought up quite frequently. And we are trying to work it through. There is an old policy in place that needs to be renewed and reviewed, given the new realities of GPE or GPE or GPE or wherever. And so I have told PERSON, Let us just make sure our visa policy is fair and balanced. So we can count on your help? I am not sure you can count on the results, but you can count on my interest. ENTITY, you are going to meet President PERSON in GPE. And in GPE, many people are concerned about corrosion of democracy in GPE. And you, in a summit in GPE, you also raised the issue of GPE's curb on democracy. So how much you are concerned about this issue of GPE? Well, I have a good relationship with President PERSON.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Slovak State Television

text: And the reason-and that is important, because that then will give me a chance to say in private-ask him why he is been making some of the decisions he is been making. I mean, he is done some things that has concerned people. And I-it is going to be-I want him to be able to have a chance to say he is done it for this reason or done that, so I can explain to him as best I can- in a friendly way, of course-that NORP values are-you know, are based upon transparency and rule of law, the right for the people to express themselves, checks and balances in government In other words, not CARDINAL part of the government is so powerful they can overwhelm all the rest of the government. And I am looking forward to doing that right there in your beautiful country. Listen, I think this is going to be my 12th meeting with President PERSON. It is an important relationship that we will continue to nurture and work. You mentioned the war in GPE and relationship. What is your personal lesson how this war in GPE changed relationship between GPE and Europe and built relation with Eastern Europe? Yes, I appreciate that very much. First of all, war is a terrible thing. And a lot of Europe supported the decision to enforce the ORG resolutions. Remember, this was not a GPE know, this came about as a result of ORG passing CARDINAL, which said-and by the way, the 16th resolution to Mr. PERSON that said, Disarm, disclose, or face serious consequences. He chose not to do either, so he faced serious consequences. And a lot of Europe supported the decision to go and have him face serious consequences because the international body, ORG, needed to be credible when it spoke. And NORP were great friends on this subject, and it is interesting. They understand what it means to live under tyranny. They know what it means to have secret police. And they began to smell that great freedom that comes, and then all of a sudden, democracies began to emerge. And what a fantastic example for the world, and Europe benefits with countries like GPE a part of ORG or ORG. I mean, these are very important lessons for people to see, that you cannot take freedom for granted, and freedom is hard, and democracy is hard work.
label: dialogic

metadata.title: Interview With Slovak State Television
